The World Health Organization defines Self Care as the 
ability of individuals, families and communities to promote, maintain health, prevent disease and to cope with illness and disability with or without the support of a health care provider. Self care encompasses several issues including hygiene, nutrition, lifestyle, environmental and socio-economic factors. Promotion of self care is a means to empower individuals, families and communities for informed health decision-making. It has the potential of improving the efficiency of health systems and contribute towards health equity. 
This handbook is designed to provide essential information 
related to the human body and measures that need to be adopted to preserve and promote health as well as prevent disease. It contains information about what individuals can do themselves when illness strikes.
